findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint an unlimited number of tokens by calling the `mint` function, which can lead to highly inflated contract tokens.

findings.title: State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed after being set and decrease gas consumption of corresponding transactions.

findings.title: Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: In Solidity, dead code is code that is written in the contract, but is never executed or reached during normal contract execution.

findings.title: Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.

findings.title: Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The team is advised to lock the pragma to ensure the stability of the codebase.
